title: ineAtlas.data
text:
Data source
The data comes from INE’s Atlas de Distribución de Renta de los Hogares, which combines administrative tax data with population statistics to provide detailed information about income distribution and related socioeconomic indicators across the country.

title: ineAtlas.data
text:
Geographic levels
Data is available at three geographic levels:

Municipality (Municipio)
District (Distrito)
Census tract (Sección censal)

title: ineAtlas.data
text:
Available datasets
The repository contains the following datasets:








Dataset
Description
File_Pattern




Income
Income indicators including net/gross income per capita and household income
income_*.csv


Income sources
Income distribution by source (wages, pensions, benefits, etc.)
income_sources_*.csv


Demographics
Population characteristics including age structure and household composition
demographics_*.csv


Distribution by sex
Income distribution indicators disaggregated by sex
distribution_sex_*.csv


Distribution by sex & age
Income distribution indicators by sex and age categories
distribution_sex_age_*.csv


Distribution by sex, age & Nationality
Income distribution indicators by sex and nationality status
distribution_sex_age_nationality_*.csv


Inequality indicators
Inequality metrics including Gini coefficient and P80/P20 ratio
gini_p80p20_*.csv

title: ineAtlas.data
text:
Using with ineAtlas package
While this data can be used independently, it’s designed to work seamlessly with the ineAtlas R package, which provides functions for easily accessing and analyzing the data:
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("pablogguz/ineAtlas")

library(ineAtlas)
See the ineAtlas package documentation for complete usage instructions and examples.

title: ineAtlas.data
text:
Updates
The data in this repository is automatically updated when new releases of the Atlas de Distribución de Renta de los Hogares are published by INE. Updates are processed using the pipeline in the main ineAtlas repository.

title: ineAtlas.data
text:
Metadata
You can find the metadata and methodology in the Spanish Statistical Office (INE) website here.

title: ineAtlas.data
text:
About the author
Hi! I’m Pablo. I do applied microeconomic and policy research at a multilateral development bank. In my free time, I enjoy working on data projects and contributing to open-source software.

title: Income
text: This dataset contains basic income indicators at different geographic levels from INE’s Atlas de Distribución de Renta de los Hogares.

title: Income
text: This dataset contains basic income indicators at different geographic levels from INE’s Atlas de Distribución de Renta de los Hogares.

title: Income
text:
Files

income_municipality.csv: Municipality-level data
income_district.csv: District-level data
income_tract.csv: Census tract-level data

title: Income
text:

Variable
Spanish original
Description
Type




mun_code
Código de municipio
Municipality identifier code
character


mun_name
Nombre de municipio
Municipality name
character

Código de distrito
District identifier code
character

Código de sección censal
Census tract identifier code
character


year

Reference year
numeric


net_income_pc
Renta neta media por persona
Average net income per capita (€)
numeric


net_income_hh
Renta neta media por hogar
Average net household income (€)
numeric


net_income_equiv
Media de la renta por unidad de consumo
Mean equivalised income (€)
numeric


median_income_equiv
Mediana de la renta por unidad de consumo
Median equivalised income (€)
numeric


gross_income_pc
Renta bruta media por persona
Average gross income per capita (€)
numeric


gross_income_hh
Renta bruta media por hogar
Average gross household income (€)
numeric



* Only available in respective geographic level files
